LobbyView
  • API Documentation
  • View page source

API DocumentationÔÉÅ

Python wrapper for Lobbyview Rest API; uses same endpoints and parameter names as outlined in the [LobbyView Rest API Documentation](https://rest-api.lobbyview.org/)

The LobbyView API provides access to data on lobbying activities in the United States, including information on legislators, bills, clients, reports, issues, networks, texts, quarter-level networks, and bill-client networks.

class lobbyview.LobbyView.BillClientNetworkResponse(data)ÔÉÅ

class lobbyview.LobbyView.LobbyView(lobbyview_token, test_connection=True)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Main class for interacting with the LobbyView API.

bill_client_networks(congress_number=None, bill_chamber=None, bill_resolution_type=None, bill_number=None, report_uuid=None, issue_ordi=None, client_uuid=None, page=1)ÔÉÅ

Gets bill-client network information from the LobbyView API based on the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • congress_number ‚Äì Session of Congress

  • bill_chamber ‚Äì Chamber of the legislative branch (Component of the bill_id composite key)

  • bill_resolution_type ‚Äì Bill type (Component of the bill_id composite key)

  • bill_number ‚Äì Bill number (Component of the bill_id composite key)

  • report_uuid ‚Äì Unique identifier of the report

  • issue_ordi ‚Äì An integer given to the issue

  • client_uuid ‚Äì Unique identifier of the client

  • page ‚Äì Page number of the results

Returns:

BillClientNetworkResponse object containing the bill-client network data

>>> lobbyview = LobbyView(LOBBYVIEW_TOKEN)
>>> output = lobbyview.bill_client_networks(congress_number=114, bill_chamber="H", bill_number=1174, client_uuid="44563806-56d2-5e99-84a1-95d22a7a69b3")
>>> output.data[0]['issue_ordi']
2
bills(congress_number=None, bill_chamber=None, bill_resolution_type=None, bill_number=None, bill_state=None, legislator_id=None, min_introduced_date=None, max_introduced_date=None, min_updated_date=None, max_updated_date=None, page=1)ÔÉÅ

Gets bill information from the LobbyView API based on the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • congress_number ‚Äì Session of Congress

  • bill_chamber ‚Äì Chamber of the legislative branch (Component of the bill_id composite key)

  • bill_resolution_type ‚Äì Bill type (Component of the bill_id composite key)

  • bill_number ‚Äì Bill number (Component of the bill_id composite key)

  • bill_state ‚Äì Bill status

  • legislator_id ‚Äì Sponsor of the bill

  • min_introduced_date ‚Äì Minimum date of introduction to Congress (YYYY-MM-DD)

  • max_introduced_date ‚Äì Maximum date of introduction to Congress (YYYY-MM-DD)

  • min_updated_date ‚Äì Minimum date of most recent status change (YYYY-MM-DD)

  • max_updated_date ‚Äì Maximum date of most recent status change (YYYY-MM-DD)

  • page ‚Äì Page number of the results

Returns:

BillResponse object containing the bill data

>>> lobbyview = LobbyView(LOBBYVIEW_TOKEN)
>>> output = lobbyview.bills(congress_number=111, bill_chamber="H", bill_number=4173)
>>> output.data[0]['bill_state']
'ENACTED:SIGNED'
clients(client_uuid=None, client_name=None, min_naics=None, max_naics=None, naics_description=None, page=1)ÔÉÅ

Gets client information from the LobbyView API based on the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • client_uuid ‚Äì Unique identifier of the client

  • client_name ‚Äì Name of the client

  • min_naics ‚Äì Minimum NAICS code to which the client belongs

  • max_naics ‚Äì Maximum NAICS code to which the client belongs

  • naics_description ‚Äì Descriptions of the NAICS code

  • page ‚Äì Page number of the results

Returns:

ClientResponse object containing the client data

>>> lobbyview = LobbyView(LOBBYVIEW_TOKEN)
>>> output = lobbyview.clients(client_name="Microsoft Corporation")
>>> output.data[0]['client_uuid']
'44563806-56d2-5e99-84a1-95d22a7a69b3'
get_data(query_string)ÔÉÅ

Sends a GET request to the LobbyView API with the provided query string. Returns the JSON response data.

Parameters:

query_string ‚Äì Query string for the API endpoint

Returns:

JSON data from the API response

Raises:

  • UnauthorizedError ‚Äì If the API returns a 401 Unauthorized status code

  • TooManyRequestsError ‚Äì If the API returns a 429 Too Many Requests status code

  • PartialContentError ‚Äì If the API returns a 206 Partial Content status code

  • UnexpectedStatusCodeError ‚Äì If the API returns an unexpected status code

issues(report_uuid=None, issue_ordi=None, issue_code=None, gov_entity=None, page=1)ÔÉÅ

Gets issue information from the LobbyView API based on the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • report_uuid ‚Äì Unique identifier of the report

  • issue_ordi ‚Äì An integer given to the issue

  • issue_code ‚Äì General Issue Area Code (Section 15)

  • gov_entity ‚Äì House(s) of Congress and Federal agencies (Section 17)

  • page ‚Äì Page number of the results

Returns:

IssueResponse object containing the issue data

>>> lobbyview = LobbyView(LOBBYVIEW_TOKEN)
>>> output = lobbyview.issues(issue_code="TRD")
legislators(legislator_id=None, legislator_govtrack_id=None, legislator_first_name=None, legislator_last_name=None, legislator_full_name=None, legislator_gender=None, min_birthday=None, max_birthday=None, page=1)ÔÉÅ

Gets legislator information from the LobbyView API based on the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • legislator_id ‚Äì Unique identifier of the legislator from LobbyView

  • legislator_govtrack_id ‚Äì Unique identifier of the legislator from GovTrack

  • legislator_first_name ‚Äì First name of the legislator

  • legislator_last_name ‚Äì Last name of the legislator

  • legislator_full_name ‚Äì Full name of the legislator

  • legislator_gender ‚Äì Gender of the legislator

  • min_birthday ‚Äì Minimum birthday of the legislator (YYYY-MM-DD)

  • max_birthday ‚Äì Maximum birthday of the legislator (YYYY-MM-DD)

  • page ‚Äì Page number of the results

Returns:

LegislatorResponse object containing the legislator data

>>> lobbyview = LobbyView(LOBBYVIEW_TOKEN)
>>> output = lobbyview.legislators(legislator_first_name="John", legislator_last_name="McCain")
>>> output.data[0]['legislator_id']
'M000303'
>>> output = lobbyview.legislators(legislator_id="M000303")
>>> output.data[0]['legislator_full_name']
'John McCain'
networks(client_uuid=None, legislator_id=None, min_report_year=None, max_report_year=None, min_bills_sponsored=None, max_bills_sponsored=None, page=1)ÔÉÅ

Gets network information from the LobbyView API based on the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • client_uuid ‚Äì Unique identifier of the client

  • legislator_id ‚Äì Unique identifier of the legislator

  • min_report_year ‚Äì Minimum year of the report

  • max_report_year ‚Äì Maximum year of the report

  • min_bills_sponsored ‚Äì Minimum number of bills sponsored by the legislator in a specific year lobbied by the client

  • max_bills_sponsored ‚Äì Maximum number of bills sponsored by the legislator in a specific year lobbied by the client

  • page ‚Äì Page number of the results

Returns:

NetworkResponse object containing the network data

>>> lobbyview = LobbyView(LOBBYVIEW_TOKEN)
>>> output = lobbyview.networks(client_uuid="44563806-56d2-5e99-84a1-95d22a7a69b3", legislator_id="M000303")
>>> output.data[0]['report_year']
2017
paginate(**kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Paginates the data retrieval from the LobbyView API using lazy evaluation via a genrator that yields results one at a time.

Parameters:

  • func ‚Äì The API endpoint function to be paginated.

  • kwargs ‚Äì Additional keyword arguments to be passed to the API endpoint function.

Returns:

A generator object that yields paginated results one item at a time.

Raises:

  • PartialContentError ‚Äì If the API returns a 206 Partial Content status code

  • LobbyViewError ‚Äì If a different error occurs during pagination

example usage:

for legislator in paginate(lobbyview.legislators, legislator_state=‚ÄôCA‚Äô):

print(f‚ÄôLegislator: {legislator[‚Äòlegislator_full_name‚Äô]}‚Äô)

for bill in paginate(lobbyview.bills, congress_number=117, bill_resolution_type=‚Äôhr‚Äô):

print(f‚ÄôBill: {bill[‚Äòbill_number‚Äô]} - {bill[‚Äòbill_title‚Äô]}‚Äô)

for client in paginate(lobbyview.clients, client_name=‚ÄôMicrosoft‚Äô, min_naics=500000):

print(f‚ÄôClient: {client[‚Äòclient_name‚Äô]} - NAICS: {client[‚Äòprimary_naics‚Äô]}‚Äô)

quarter_level_networks(client_uuid=None, legislator_id=None, report_year=None, report_quarter_code=None, min_bills_sponsored=None, max_bills_sponsored=None, page=1)ÔÉÅ

Gets quarter-level network information from the LobbyView API based on the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • client_uuid ‚Äì Unique identifier of the client

  • legislator_id ‚Äì Unique identifier of the legislator

  • report_year ‚Äì Year of the report

  • report_quarter_code ‚Äì Quarter period of the report

  • min_bills_sponsored ‚Äì Minimum number of bills sponsored by the legislator in a specific quarter lobbied by the client

  • max_bills_sponsored ‚Äì Maximum number of bills sponsored by the legislator in a specific quarter lobbied by the client

  • page ‚Äì Page number of the results

Returns:

QuarterLevelNetworkResponse object containing the quarter-level network data

>>> lobbyview = LobbyView(LOBBYVIEW_TOKEN)
>>> output = lobbyview.quarter_level_networks(client_uuid="44563806-56d2-5e99-84a1-95d22a7a69b3", legislator_id="M000303", report_year=2017, report_quarter_code=4)
>>> output.data[0]['n_bills_sponsored']
1
reports(report_uuid=None, client_uuid=None, registrant_uuid=None, registrant_name=None, report_year=None, report_quarter_code=None, min_amount=None, max_amount=None, is_no_activity=None, is_client_self_filer=None, is_amendment=None, page=1)ÔÉÅ

Gets report information from the LobbyView API based on the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • report_uuid ‚Äì Unique identifier of the report

  • client_uuid ‚Äì Unique identifier of the client

  • registrant_uuid ‚Äì Unique identifier of the registrant

  • registrant_name ‚Äì Name of the registrant

  • report_year ‚Äì Year of the report

  • report_quarter_code ‚Äì Quarter period of the report

  • min_amount ‚Äì Minimum lobbying firm income or lobbying expense (in-house)

  • max_amount ‚Äì Maximum lobbying firm income or lobbying expense (in-house)

  • is_no_activity ‚Äì Quarterly activity indicator

  • is_client_self_filer ‚Äì An organization employing its own in-house lobbyist(s)

  • is_amendment ‚Äì Amendment of previous report

  • page ‚Äì Page number of the results

Returns:

ReportResponse object containing the report data

>>> lobbyview = LobbyView(LOBBYVIEW_TOKEN)
>>> output = lobbyview.reports(report_year=2020, report_quarter_code="2", is_client_self_filer=True, report_uuid="4b799814-3e94-5ee1-8dd4-b32aead9aca6")
>>> output.data[0]['amount']
'$11,680,000.00'
texts(report_uuid=None, issue_ordi=None, issue_code=None, issue_text=None, page=1)ÔÉÅ

Gets issue text data from the LobbyView API based on the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • report_uuid ‚Äì Unique identifier of the report

  • issue_ordi ‚Äì An integer given to the issue

  • issue_code ‚Äì General Issue Area Code (Section 15)

  • issue_text ‚Äì Specific lobbying issues (Section 16)

  • page ‚Äì Page number of the results

Returns:

TextResponse object containing the text data

>>> lobbyview = LobbyView(LOBBYVIEW_TOKEN)
>>> output = lobbyview.texts(issue_code="HCR", issue_text="covid")
